content.title: Kangaroos legend backs Broncos signing Matt Lodge to play for Australia - Fox Sports
Lodge, Pangai aim to become Blues brothers - SBS News
content.desc: Brisbane forwards Tevita Pangai and Matt Lodge hope to earn NSW selection together in 2019 after hailing their friendship as the key to re-signing.

content.title: Fans convinced me to sign new Broncos deal, says Lodge - The Sydney Morning Herald
content.desc: Matt Lodge has signed a new two-year deal with the Broncos, thanking fans for their welcome after his controversial return to the NRL earlier this year.

content.title: Demetriou’s departure imminent - The Australian
content.desc: Brisbane have announced the retention of Matt Lodge on a two-year-deal and stepped up talks to farewell assistant coach Jason Demetriou. Lodge was offered substantial money to leave the Broncos but a sense of loyalty to the club that helped him revive his career convinced him to stay. Reports of a mass exodus in the wake of Wayne Bennett’s departure are proving unfounded, unless the speculation is extended to include coaching staff, as assistant coach Jason Demetriou steps up talks over his exit. The players are going nowhere. Lodge yesterday confirmed he would remain at the Broncos for a f...
